message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.CL

Reasoning: The paper proposes empirical measures to quantify bias in social and mainstream media, which involves analyzing large-scale communication networks. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) or Sound and Music Computing (cs.SD), which deal with network analysis and data mining. Additionally, the paper uses a generative model to explain the observed differences in media bias, which could fall under the sub-categories of Cybernetics (cs.CY) or Information Retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper also involves analyzing text data to identify biases in news and blog media, which could be relevant to the sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL).
